message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has atrial fibrillation and is prescribed a β-adrenergic blocking agent. Among the options, Atenolol is the most commonly prescribed one for atrial fibrillation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Atenolol is commonly used for treating and preventing heart attacks and atrial fibrillation. It is also preferred in patients with asthma or chronic obstructive pulmonary disease since it has less bronchoconstrictive effect compared to other β-blockers.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Atenolol is a commonly used β-blocker for the treatment of atrial fibrillation and myocardial infarction. Celiprolol is also used but less frequently, while Penbutolol and Pindolol are not commonly used for these conditions.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient presents with an acute Q-wave myocardial infarction and subsequently develops atrial fibrillation. β-blockers are commonly prescribed in such cases. Atenolol is a commonly used β-blocker for heart conditions. Celiprolol, penbutolol, and pindolol are also β-blockers but not as commonly used for heart conditions as atenolol.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Atenolol is a commonly used β-adrenergic blocking agent in the treatment of arrhythmias and has been shown to reduce the risk of recurrent MI. The other options are less commonly used or less effective in this context.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Atenolol has been shown to be effective in reducing mortality following an acute myocardial infarction.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Atenolol is commonly used for the treatment of atrial fibrillation and is a selective β1-adrenergic blocking agent, making it less likely to cause bronchoconstriction. Celiprolol is also a selective β1 antagonist, but it has additional vasodilatory properties. Penbutolol and Pindolol are non-selective β-blocking agents.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Atenolol is a commonly used β-adrenergic blocking agent for the management of arrhythmias and hypertension. It has been shown to reduce the incidence of recurrent MI and mortality in post-MI patients. The patient's history of past episodes and the electrocardiogram findings are consistent with an acute Q-wave MI, making β-blockers appropriate for long-term management. Celiprolol and penbutolol are not commonly used for arrhythmias, and pindolol is not recommended for post-MI patients.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Atenolol is a commonly prescribed β-adrenergic blocking agent for controlling various heart conditions, including arrhythmias. Atenolol also has a longer half-life, which reduces the chances of side effects and ensures that the medication remains in the body for an extended duration.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has atrial fibrillation and has a history of MI. Atenolol is a commonly used β-blocker in patients with MI and atrial fibrillation. Celiprolol has intrinsic sympathomimetic activity, which may not be optimal in this case. Penbutolol and Pindolol are not commonly used in the treatment of MI or atrial fibrillation.
